description: From Middle English fortaste, equivalent to fore- +‎ taste (noun).

entries.meaning: A sample taken in anticipation; an experience undergone in advance.
examples: When she sang in the kirk, folk have told me that they had a foretaste of the musick of the New Jerusalem, and when she came in by the village of Caulds old men stottered to their doors to look at her.

description: From Middle English fortasten, equivalent to fore- +‎ taste (verb).

verbs.description: foretaste (third-person singular simple present foretastes, present participle foretasting, simple past and past participle foretasted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To taste before possession; have previous experience of; enjoy by anticipation.
